intro: Chaerophyllum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedge parsley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
